member.name: T:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes
member.summary: Represents the media types

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.ApplicationXJavascript
member.summary: Used to denote the encoding necessary for files containing JavaScript source code. The alternative MIME type for this file type is text/javascript.

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.AudioL24
member.summary: 24bit Linear PCM audio at 8-48kHz, 1-N channels; Defined in RFC 3190

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.ApplicationXShockwaveFlash
member.summary: Adobe Flash files for example with the extension .swf

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.ApplicationOctetStream
member.summary: Arbitrary binary data.[5] Generally speaking this type identifies files that are not associated with a specific application. Contrary to past assumptions by software packages such as Apache this is not a type that should be applied to unknown files. In such a case, a server or application should not indicate a content type, as it may be incorrect, but rather, should omit the type in order to allow the recipient to guess the type.[6]

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.ApplicationAtomXml
member.summary: Atom feeds

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.TextCss
member.summary: Cascading Style Sheets; Defined in RFC 2318

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.TextCmd
member.summary: commands; subtype resident in Gecko browsers like Firefox 3.5

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.TextCsv
member.summary: Comma-separated values; Defined in RFC 4180

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.ApplicationXDeb
member.summary: deb (file format), a software package format used by the Debian project

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.MultipartEncrypted
member.summary: Defined in RFC 1847

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.MultipartSigned
member.summary: Defined in RFC 1847

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.MessageHttp
member.summary: Defined in RFC 2616

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.ModelExample
member.summary: Defined in RFC 4735

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.ApplicationXDvi
member.summary: device-independent document in DVI format

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.ApplicationXmlDtd
member.summary: DTD files; Defined by RFC 3023

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.ApplicationJavascript
member.summary: ECMAScript/JavaScript; Defined in RFC 4329 (equivalent to application/ecmascript but with looser processing rules) It is not accepted in IE 8 or earlier - text/javascript is accepted but it is defined as obsolete in RFC 4329. The "type" attribute of the script tag in HTML5 is optional and in practice omitting the media type of JavaScript programs is the most interoperable solution since all browsers have always assumed the correct default even before HTML5

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.ApplicationEcmascript
member.summary: ECMAScript/JavaScript; Defined in RFC 4329 (equivalent to application/javascript but with stricter processing rules)

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.ApplicationEdifact
member.summary: EDI EDIFACT data; Defined in RFC 1767

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.ApplicationEdiX12
member.summary: EDI X12 data; Defined in RFC 1767

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.MessagePartial
member.summary: Email; Defined in RFC 2045 and RFC 2046

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.MessageRfc822
member.summary: Email; EML files, MIME files, MHT files, MHTML files; Defined in RFC 2045 and RFC 2046

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.TextXml
member.summary: Extensible Markup Language; Defined in RFC 3023

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.VideoXFlv
member.summary: Flash video (FLV files)

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.ImageGif
member.summary: GIF image; Defined in RFC 2045 and RFC 2046

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.TextXGwtRpc
member.summary: GoogleWebToolkit data

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.ApplicationXGzip
member.summary: Gzip

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.TextHtml
member.summary: HTML; Defined in RFC 2854

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.ImageVndMicrosoftIcon
member.summary: ICO image; Registered[9]

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.ModelIges
member.summary: IGS files, IGES files; Defined in RFC 2077

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.MessageImdnXml
member.summary: IMDN Instant Message Disposition Notification; Defined in RFC 5438

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.ApplicationJson
member.summary: JavaScript Object Notation JSON; Defined in RFC 4627

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.ApplicationJsonPatch
member.summary: JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) Patch; Defined in RFC 6902

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.TextJavascript
member.summary: JavaScript - Defined in and obsoleted by RFC 4329 in order to discourage its usage in favor of application/javascript. However,text/javascript is allowed in HTML 4 and 5 and, unlike application/javascript, has cross-browser support. The "type" attribute of the script tag in HTML5 is optional and there is no need to use it at all since all browsers have always assumed the correct default (even in HTML 4 where it was required by the specification).

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.ImagePjpeg
member.summary: JPEG JFIF image; Associated with Internet Explorer; Listed in ms775147(v=vs.85) - Progressive JPEG, initiated before global browser support for progressive JPEGs (Microsoft and Firefox).

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.ImageJpeg
member.summary: JPEG JFIF image; Defined in RFC 2045 and RFC 2046

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.TextXJqueryTmpl
member.summary: jQuery template data

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.ApplicationVndGoogleEarthKmlXml
member.summary: KML files (e.g. for Google Earth)

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.ApplicationXLatex
member.summary: LaTeX files

member.summary: Microsoft Word 2007 files

member.summary: Microsoft Word files[15]

member.summary: MIME Email; Defined in RFC 2045 and RFC 2046

member.summary: MIME Email; Defined in RFC 2045 and RFC 2046

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.MultipartFormData
member.summary: MIME Webform; Defined in RFC 2388

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.ApplicationVndMozillaXulXml
member.summary: Mozilla XUL files

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.AudioMpeg
member.summary: MP3 or other MPEG audio; Defined in RFC 3003

member.summary: MP4 video; Defined in RFC 4337

member.name: F:Restion.Constants.MediaTypes.ApplicationXopXml
